result.translation: By the sun and its brightness,
and by the moon as it follows it[1],
result.footnotes: [1] i.e., appears after the sun disappears.

result.translation: and by the day as it displays it[2],
result.footnotes: [2] i.e., the earth or the sun.

result.translation: and by the night as it covers it[3],
result.footnotes: [3] i.e., the earth or the sun.

result.translation: and by the sky and how He made it,
and by the earth and how He spread it,
and by the soul and how He fashioned it[4],
then inspired it [to know] its wickedness and righteousness,
Indeed, he who purifies his soul will attain success,
and he who corrupts it will be doomed.
Thamūd rejected [the messenger] because of their transgression,
when the most wretched among them rose[5].
result.footnotes: [5] To kill the camel that Allah sent as a miracle to them.

result.arabic_text: فَقَالَ لَهُمۡ رَسُولُ ٱللَّهِ نَاقَةَ ٱللَّهِ وَسُقۡيَٰهَا
result.translation: Although the messenger of Allah warned them, “Hands off the she-camel of Allah and her drink!”

result.arabic_text: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَعَقَرُوهَا فَدَمۡدَمَ عَلَيۡهِمۡ رَبُّهُم بِذَنۢبِهِمۡ فَسَوَّىٰهَا
result.translation: Yet they rejected him and hamstrung her[6]. So their Lord destroyed them for their sin and leveled them to the ground.
And He has no fear of the consequences thereof[7].
result.footnotes: [7] Allah is not asked for what He does, but His slaves will be asked. See 21:23
